Package apcs.playList

Class PlayList

  • java.lang.Object
    • apcs.playList.PlayList
  • public class PlayList
extends java.lang.Object
    The PlayList class allows the client to modify a playlist of songs with a number of playlist management methods operations from custom methods including those to add songs to the playlist, retrieve/print the playlist, change songs, and remove songs. (among other functions). This class utilizes arrays to keep track of the songs, plays, and other aspects of the playlist.
    Author:
    Shriya Biddala and Vasilisa Malenkiy

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      PlayList​(int capacity)
      This is a constructor; it initializes the size of both Songs and Plays arrays to the variable capacity.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void add​(int index, java.lang.String songName)
      Allows the user to add songs to an index (location) of their playlist while recording the number of times it has been played.

      Allows the user to add their songs into the songs array.
      int capacity()
      Sets the length of the songs array.
      java.lang.String getFavorite()
      Find the client's favorite songs based on the number of times it was played (referring to the plays array).
      int getPlays​(int index)
      Returns the value of the plays array stored at the specified index.
      java.lang.String getSong​(int index)
      Allows the user to access a particular song at its index of the songs array.
      int indexOf​(java.lang.String songName)
      Accepts a String of song name, loops through the songs array and if an item in the songs array that matches the name parameter, the method returns the index of the matching song.
      java.lang.String play​(int index)
      "Plays" the song that was requested by the client.
      void remove​(int index)
      Removes the song at the requested index.
      void set​(int index, java.lang.String songName)
      Sets the index (location) of a song the user inputs (the user can set the location of their songs in their playlist), after the user adds it.
      int size()
      Accesses the sizes (the number of elements in both arrays regardless of their capacity) of both the songs and the number of plays arrays.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlayList

        public PlayList​(int capacity)
        This is a constructor; it initializes the size of both Songs and Plays arrays to the variable capacity.
        Parameters:
        capacity - The actual size of both Songs and Plays arrays.

    • Method Detail

      • size

        public int size()
        Accesses the sizes (the number of elements in both arrays regardless of their capacity) of both the songs and the number of plays arrays.
        Returns:
        Returns the current size of the playlist.

      • capacity

        public int capacity()
        Sets the length of the songs array.
        Returns:
        The current length of the songs array.

      • add

        public void add​(java.lang.String song_name)
        Allows the user to add their songs into the songs array.
        Parameters:
        song_name - The name of the song that the user inputs.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • getSong

        public java.lang.String getSong​(int index)
        Allows the user to access a particular song at its index of the songs array. Throws an exception if the requested index is out of bounds, hence "the requested index (the song's location) is out of bounds".
        Parameters:
        index - The index where the requested song is at.
        Returns:
        Returns the index of where the requested song is located in the array.

      • getPlays

        public int getPlays​(int index)
        Returns the value of the plays array stored at the specified index. Throws an exception if the requested index is out of bounds, hence "the requested index (the song's location) is out of bounds".
        Parameters:
        index - The location (index) where the requested play resides within the plays array.
        Returns:
        the value of the plays array stored at the specified index

      • play

        public java.lang.String play​(int index)
        "Plays" the song that was requested by the client. Throws an exception if the requested song isn't within the songs array, hence "the requested index (the song's location) is out of bounds".
        Parameters:
        index - The location (index) where the requested song is located at within the songs array.
        Returns:
        Returns the song at the index where the requested song is located at.

      • indexOf

        public int indexOf​(java.lang.String songName)
        Accepts a String of song name, loops through the songs array and if an item in the songs array that matches the name parameter, the method returns the index of the matching song.
        Parameters:
        songName - The name of the song the user wants the index of in the songs array.
        Returns:
        The index of the song that matches the songName parameter. If no song in the songs array matches the songName parameter, the method returns -1.

      • remove

        public void remove​(int index)
        Removes the song at the requested index. Throws an exception if the requested index is out of bounds, hence "the requested index (the song's location) is out of bounds".
        Parameters:
        index - The requested location (index) where the user wants the song to be removed, within the songs array.

      • add

        public void add​(int index,
                java.lang.String songName)
        Allows the user to add songs to an index (location) of their playlist while recording the number of times it has been played. Throws an exception if the songs array is full and/or the requested location isn't within the songs array.
        Parameters:
        index - Keeps track of the index of the item.
        songName - The name of the song the user wants to add the location of.

      • set

        public void set​(int index,
                java.lang.String songName)
        Sets the index (location) of a song the user inputs (the user can set the location of their songs in their playlist), after the user adds it.
        Parameters:
        index - The index where is going to be set at.
        songName - The name of the song the user want to set into the songs array.

      • getFavorite

        public java.lang.String getFavorite()
        Find the client's favorite songs based on the number of times it was played (referring to the plays array).
        Returns:
        The name of the client's favorite song.
